articleContentTranslated: The latter is not new, however, as it has already happened twice in NFL history that a team has won its division with a negative record.
Both Seattle (2011) and Carolina (2015) then remained successful in their first round duels, also because they had home rights as division winners.
But Washington also starts as a clear underdog against the Tampa Bay Buccanaeers around old quarterback Tom Brady in the final title race of this NFL season. Tampa, where on Jan.
February Super Bowl LV is to take place, has recorded four wins more than Washington in the regular season, but not won his division and has to play in his first play-off game since 2008 abroad.

The hosts are back for the first time since 2016, but for the first time as a capital city team not with the nickname ‚ÄúRedskins‚Äù. With the dropping of the controversial nickname, a more than unusual season began for the team - and all of this regardless of the coronavirus pandemic.

Nameless through the season Even before the kick-off for the first game of the three-time Super Bowl winner (1982/83, 1987/88, 1991/92), the dispute over the old name, which had been smoldering for years, escalated in August " Redskins ‚Äùfor good.

The name was missed even before the move from Boston to Washington in 1933, but the "Black Lives Matter" movement finally caused a rethink in 2020 - financiers ultimately put enough pressure on the controversial owner Dan Snyder, who finally gave in.
Several major sponsors had distanced themselves from the club and forced it, after years of criticism, to drop the name "Redskins", which was associated with racism.
Because no new name was available so quickly - a businessman is said to have protected several potential names in good time - it was decided to initially act as the Washington Football Team.
The chief with the red-faced head in the logo has disappeared; for the time being, only the letter ‚ÄúW‚Äù adorns Washington's coat of arms. How long is open.
Under the new head coach Rivera, who had come from Carolina after his release, they made a false start and only recorded two wins after nine games. Rivera was also diagnosed with skin cancer.
"I was so angry, I felt as healthy as never before," said the 58-year-old, who is called "Riverboat Ron" because of his risky moves.

He underwent therapy for cancer, which is considered to be treatable, and worked despite the hardships. Quarterback Smith's miraculous comeback In the midst of the sporting misery, quarterback Kyle Allen also injured himself.
And so, after 693 days, Alex Smith made a comeback. The 36-year-old suffered an open fracture of the tibia and fibula in November 2018.

"The leg was twisted like it shouldn't be," recalled Smith, who was voted number one for the San Francisco 49ers in the 2005 NFL Draft. After an initial operation, bacteria and blood poisoning threatened Smith's life.
In an emergency operation, the doctors saved both this leg and his leg.

Smith's wife Elizabeth forever captured the stony and arguably miraculous way back onto the pitch by sculpting his metal leg support into a trophy - one based on the Vince Lombardi Trophy for the NFL champions.

January 2021 After a total of 17 surgeries and almost two years without football, Smith made an amazing comeback. After the brief return on matchday five, Smith finally took over the role of starting quarterback four weeks later, but had to pass injured again in the meantime.

Playmaker Dwayne Haskins, who was voted number 15 in the first round in 2019, failed to meet expectations on and off the field. After a trip to a nightclub, where he could also be seen without mouth and nose protection, he was released.

The team was not deterred by this either. Defensive carries team in play-offs They benefited above all from the strengthened defense around young star Chase Young, which was formed by defensive specialist Rivera and his defensive coordinator Jack del Rio.

Whether it was the unsteady quarterback game, that wasn't always enough to win, but it was enough to end up being the second-best defense in the league in terms of permitted yards - not least on the last day of the game with a 20:14 win at Philadelphia Eagles the play-off entry.

"This is so special because it was such a difficult time," said Rivera after the victory at former champion Philadelphia, whose head coach Doug Pedersen replaced his playmaker with a back-up in the fourth quarter for no apparent reason and for it bitter criticism reaped from the competition.

Washington did not care, of course, because after all, many hurdles were overcome in order to achieve the goal. ‚ÄúHow hard it was all for the boys and the club. We have a great team and we are trying to do things right.

That we won the division is very cool, ‚Äùemphasized Rivera, whose new team could only record three wins last year. The win of the weak NFC East, which automatically entitles them to participate in the play-offs, fits into the picture of this unreal season.
